TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SmsMessage extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: A Short Message Service message.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int javaReference, valuetype Android.Runtime.JniHandleOwnership transfer) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int[]? CalculateLength (Java.Lang.ICharSequence? msgBody, bool use7bitOnly);
.method public static hidebysig int32[] CalculateLength(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence msgBody, bool use7bitOnly) cil managed
static member CalculateLength : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * bool -> int[]

Docs.param: if true, characters that are not part of the radio-specific 7-bit encoding are counted as single space chars. If false, and if the messageBody contains non-7-bit encodable characters, length is calculated using a 16-bit encoding.
Docs.summary: Calculates the number of SMS's required to encode the message body and the number of characters remaining until the next message.
Docs.returns: an int[6] with int[0] being the number of SMS's required, int[1] the number of code units used, and int[2] is the number of code units remaining until the next message. int[3] is an indicator of the encoding code unit size (see the ENCODING_* definitions in SmsConstants). int[4] is the GSM national language table to use, or 0 for the default 7-bit alphabet. int[5] The GSM national language shift table to use, or 0 for the default 7-bit extension table.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public static int[]? CalculateLength (string? messageBody, bool use7bitOnly);
.method public static hidebysig int32[] CalculateLength(string messageBody, bool use7bitOnly) cil managed
static member CalculateLength : string * bool -> int[]

Docs.summary: Calculates the number of SMS's required to encode the message body and the number of characters remaining until the next message, given the current encoding.
Docs.returns: an int[4] with int[0] being the number of SMS's required, int[1] the number of code units used, and int[2] is the number of code units remaining until the next message. int[3] is the encoding type that should be used for the message.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.value: if isEmail() is true, email from address of email sent through the gateway. null otherwise

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Telephony.SmsMessage.SubmitPdu? GetSubmitPdu (string? scAddress, string? destinationAddress, string? message, bool statusReportRequested);

static member GetSubmitPdu : string * string * string * bool -> Android.Telephony.SmsMessage.SubmitPdu

Docs.param: Service Centre address. Null means use default.
the address of the destination for the message.
string representation of the message payload.
indicates whether a report is requested for this message.
Docs.summary: Gets an SMS-SUBMIT PDU for a destination address and a message.
Docs.returns: a SubmitPdu containing the encoded SC address if applicable and the encoded message. Returns null on encode error.

format.a: Java documentation for android.telephony.SmsMessage.getSubmitPdu(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean).

the address of the destination for the message.
the port to deliver the message to at the destination

Docs.summary: Returns the record index of the message on the ICC (1-based index).
Docs.value: the record index of the message on the ICC, or -1 if this SmsMessage was not created from a ICC SMS EF record.

Docs.summary: Returns the record index of the message on the SIM (1-based index).
Docs.value: the record index of the message on the SIM, or -1 if this SmsMessage was not created from a SIM SMS EF record.

Docs.summary: GSM: For an SMS-STATUS-REPORT message, this returns the status field from the status report.
Docs.value: 0 for GSM or 2 shifted left by 16 for CDMA indicates the previously sent message was received. See TS 23.040, 9.2.3.15 and C.S0015-B, v2.0, 4.5.21 for a description of other possible values.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the status of the message on the ICC (read, unread, sent, unsent).
Docs.value: the status of the message on the ICC. These are: SmsManager.STATUS_ON_ICC_FREE SmsManager.STATUS_ON_ICC_READ SmsManager.STATUS_ON_ICC_UNREAD SmsManager.STATUS_ON_ICC_SEND SmsManager.STATUS_ON_ICC_UNSENT

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Returns the status of the message on the SIM (read, unread, sent, unsent).
